other_tests.findings: Abnormal T2 signal prolongation centered around the pancreatic tail with associated enhancement and diffusion restriction compatible with pancreatitis. There is a small amount of hemorrhagic peripancreatic fluid and ascites, as well as adjacent thickening of Gerota's fascia. There are multiple gallstones in the gallbladder. The common bile duct is normal caliber measuring 5 mm. There is no intra or extrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation. The spleen, kidneys, and liver are notable only for a small left renal cyst. No hydronephrosis. Both kidneys enhance symmetrically. The portal vein, SMV and splenic veins are patent. The image portions of the abdominal aorta are normal caliber. No upper abdominal lymphadenopathy. Imaged portions of the bowel are unremarkable. The visualized heart, lung bases, bones, and soft tissues are unremarkable.
